1.SceneDescription: Monica and Rachel's apartment. Everyone is sitting at the couches,NEWLINEChandler enters.

lines.Line: Okay, what is it about me? Do I not look fun enough? Is there something. . .NEWLINErepellent. . . about me

No, not weight... y'know, more like insulation

lines.Line: C'mon give me five more. Five more

lines.Line: I don't know if Monica told you but this is the first date I've gone on sinceNEWLINEmy divorce so, if I seem a little nervous, I am

4.SceneDescription: A Restaurant, Rachel pours the last of the champagne bottle in her glass.

lines.Line: (obviously drunk) I mean, it's a cat, y'know, it's a cat. Why can't theyNEWLINEget one of those bugs, y'know, one of those fruit flies, those things that live for like aNEWLINEday or something? (belligerently) What're they called, what're they called, what're theyNEWLINEcalled

No! No dessert, just a check, please
Oh, you're not having fun, are you
Oh, you're not having fun, are you
No, no, I am, but only because for the last hour and a half I've been playingNEWLINEthe movie Diner in my head
Oh, Look at me, Look at me. Oh, I'm on a date with a really great guy, all INEWLINEcan think about is Ross and his cat and his... Julie. I just want to get over him. gosh,NEWLINEwhy can't I do that
Oy. Look, I've been through a divorce, trust me you're gonna be fine. You justNEWLINEcan't see it now because you haven't had any closure
Yeah! Closure. That's what it is, that's what I need. God, you're brilliant!NEWLINEWhy didn't I think of that? How do I get that
Well, you know, there's no one way really, it's just, you know, whatever itNEWLINEtakes so that you can finally say to him, I'm over you
Closure, that's what it is. Closure. (she Looks around the restaurant, spottingNEWLINEa guy with a cellular phone) Hello, excuse me. Excuse me, hel—woo (she almost fallsNEWLINEout of her chair
Hi, I'm sorry, I need to borrow your phone for just one minute
I can see that. I—just one phone call, I'll be very quick, I'll even payNEWLINEfor it myself. (man is still reluctant) Okay, you're bein' a little weird about yourNEWLINEphone
All right, fine. (on the phone) I'll call you back. (hands the phone to her
Thank you. Okay. (dials) (to Michael) Machine. Just waiting for the beep

(on phone) Ross, hi, it's Rachel. I'm just calling to say that um, everything'sNEWLINEfine and I'm really happy for you and your cat who, by the way, I think you should nameNEWLINEMichael. And, you know, ya see there I'm thinking of names so obviously, I am over you. INEWLINEam over you and that, my friend, is what they call closure. (hangs up and tosses phone inNEWLINEthe ice bucket

5.SceneDescription: Rachel and Monica's, Rachel is taking aspirin.

lines.Line: Oh. And how was the date?
Umm, I think there was a restaurant... I know there was wine. .

lines.Character: (Rachel looks at Ross as though she remembers something, but can't place what it is

lines.Character: (Rachel comes out of her room, suddenly she remembers leaving the message

6.SceneDescription: Central Perk, Rachel is closing up and Ross comes in.

lines.Line: No, no it's not interesting. Okay, it's very, very not interesting. In fact it'sNEWLINEactually 100 percent completely opposite of interesting

Then you should have said something before I met her

lines.Character: (Rachel gets up and opens the door, yelling after him
lines.Line: Rachel gets up and opens the door, yelling after him.

lines.Character: (Rachel slams the door and locks it. She sits down, visibly upset. She puts her head inNEWLINEher hands and begins to cry. Ross comes back and is standing outside the window. WhenNEWLINERachel regroups and gets back up to finish closing, she sees him. She smiles. She goes toNEWLINEopen the door and can't get the lock undone
